data: There is a tradition that some thousands of years ago twelve men from Britain, of a most gigantic size, and twelve men from Gaul, came over to the country of the genii, and while here were continually at war with each other; and, after remaining many years, returned again to Britain and Gaul.

THERE is a tradition that some thousands of years ago twelve men from Britain, of a most gigantic size, and twelve men from Gaul, came over to the country of the genii, and while here were continually at war with each other; and, after remaining many years, returned again to Britain and Gaul.
The twelve adventurers, and other stories
Brontë, Charlotte, 1816-1855; Hatfield, C. W. (Charles William), 1877?-1942 [Editor]; Shorter, Clement King, 1857-1926 [Editor]
